methodology: Master Prompt 2: Code Review and Bug Detection
reviewer_role: Code Quality Auditor and Security Reviewer

readability.comment: Code is clear and well-commented. Error messages are explicit. Exception handling is structured with clear separation between file I/O errors and domain errors.

maintainability.comment: Exception handling follows Python best practices. Specific exceptions caught before generic ones. Code is modular and follows established patterns.

efficiency.comment: No performance issues. Exception handling overhead is minimal and appropriate for error paths.

robustness.comment: All edge cases handled: empty JSON, malformed JSON, file I/O errors, domain errors. Exit codes are explicit (1 for errors, 0 for success). No silent failures possible.

security.comment: No security vulnerabilities. Input validation present (JSON parsing, content checks). No hardcoded secrets. Error messages don't leak sensitive information.
cwe_avoided: CWE-209: Information Exposure Through Error Messages (errors are generic)
CWE-703: Improper Exception Handling (exceptions handled correctly)
CWE-754: Improper Check for Unusual or Exceptional Conditions (all conditions checked)
